com.vaadin.polymer.iron

Interface IronDropdownElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, EventTarget, HTMLElement, Node

    @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface IronDropdownElement
extends HTMLElement

    <iron-dropdown> is a generalized element that is useful when you have
    hidden content (.dropdown-content) that is revealed due to some change in
    state that should cause it to do so.

    Note that this is a low-level element intended to be used as part of other
    composite elements that cause dropdowns to be revealed.

    Examples of elements that might be implemented using an iron-dropdown
    include comboboxes, menubuttons, selects. The list goes on.

    The <iron-dropdown> element exposes attributes that allow the position
    of the .dropdown-content relative to the .dropdown-trigger to be
    configured.

    <iron-dropdown horizontal-align="right" vertical-align="top">
   <div class="dropdown-content">Hello!</div>
 </iron-dropdown>

    In the above example, the <div> with class .dropdown-content will be
    hidden until the dropdown element has opened set to true, or when the open
    method is called on the element.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOwnKeyBinding(Object eventString, Object handlerName)
      Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
      element.
      void assignParentResizable(Object parentResizable)
      Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
      if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.
      void cancel(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject event)
      Cancels the overlay.
      void cancelAnimation()
      Cancels the currently running animations.
      void center()
      Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned.
      void close()
      Close the overlay.
      void constrain()
      Constrains the size of the element to fitInto by setting max-height
      and/or max-width.
      void fit()
      Positions and fits the element into the fitInto element.
      boolean getAllowOutsideScroll()
      By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
      to itself when opened.
      Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
      to the dropdown when it opens.
      boolean getAlwaysOnTop()
      Set to true to keep overlay always on top.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getAnimationConfig()
      Animation configuration.
      boolean getAutoFitOnAttach()
      Set to true to auto-fit on attach.
      Element getBackdropElement()
      The backdrop element.
      boolean getCanceled()
      True if the overlay was canceled when it was last closed.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getCloseAnimationConfig()
      An animation config.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getClosingReason()
      Contains the reason(s) this overlay was last closed (see iron-overlay-closed).
      IronOverlayBehavior provides the canceled reason; implementers of the
      behavior can provide other reasons in addition to canceled.
      boolean getDisabled()
      If true, the user cannot interact with this element.
      boolean getDynamicAlign()
      If true, it will use horizontalAlign and verticalAlign values as preferred alignment
      and if there’s not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.
      String getEntryAnimation()
      Convenience property for setting an ‘entry’ animation.
      String getExitAnimation()
      Convenience property for setting an ‘exit’ animation.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getFitInto()
      The element to fit this into.
      boolean getFocused()
      If true, the element currently has focus.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getFocusTarget()
      If provided, this will be the element that will be focused when
      the dropdown opens.
      String getHorizontalAlign()
      The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
      relative to the positionTarget.
      double getHorizontalOffset()
      The same as setting margin-left and margin-right css properties.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getKeyBindings()
      To be used to express what combination of keys will trigger the relative
      callback.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getKeyEventTarget()
      The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents.
      boolean getNoAnimations()
      Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
      dropdown.
      boolean getNoAutoFocus()
      Set to true to disable auto-focusing the overlay or child nodes with
      the autofocus attribute` when the overlay is opened.
      boolean getNoCancelOnEscKey()
      Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.
      boolean getNoCancelOnOutsideClick()
      Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.
      boolean getNoOverlap()
      Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getOpenAnimationConfig()
      An animation config.
      boolean getOpened()
      True if the overlay is currently displayed.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getPositionTarget()
      The element that should be used to position the element.
      boolean getRestoreFocusOnClose()
      Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getSizingTarget()
      The element that will receive a max-height/width.
      boolean getStopKeyboardEventPropagation()
      If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
      automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.
      String getVerticalAlign()
      The orientation against which to align the element vertically
      relative to the positionTarget.
      double getVerticalOffset()
      The same as setting margin-top and margin-bottom css properties.
      boolean getWithBackdrop()
      Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay.
      void invalidateTabbables()
      Invalidates the cached tabbable nodes.

      Returns true if a keyboard event matches eventString.
      void notifyResize()
      Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
      resizables of a resize change.
      void open()
      Open the overlay.

      Plays an animation with an optional type.

      Positions the element according to horizontalAlign, verticalAlign.

      void removeOwnKeyBindings()
      When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

      Resets the target element’s position and size constraints, and clear
      the memoized data.

      should not be notified by the current element.

        scrolling region inside the element.

      • addOwnKeyBinding

        void addOwnKeyBinding(Object eventString,
                      Object handlerName)

        Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
        element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
        in the keyBindings prototype property.

        JavaScript Info:

      • toggle

        void toggle()

        Toggle the opened state of the overlay.

        JavaScript Info:

      • center

        void center()

        Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned. This also sets
        position:fixed.

        JavaScript Info:

        Constrains the size of the element to fitInto by setting max-height

        Positions the element according to horizontalAlign, verticalAlign.

        JavaScript Info:

      • invalidateTabbables

        void invalidateTabbables()

        Invalidates the cached tabbable nodes. To be called when any of the focusable
        content changes (e.g. a button is disabled).

        JavaScript Info:

      • refit

        void refit()

        Equivalent to calling resetFit() and fit(). Useful to call this after
        the element or the fitInto element has been resized, or if any of the
        positioning properties (e.g. horizontalAlign, verticalAlign) is updated.
        It preserves the scroll position of the sizingTarget.

        JavaScript Info:

      • resetFit

        void resetFit()

        Resets the target element’s position and size constraints, and clear
        the memoized data.

        JavaScript Info:

      • removeOwnKeyBindings

        void removeOwnKeyBindings()

        When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

        JavaScript Info:

      • notifyResize

        void notifyResize()

        Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
        resizables of a resize change.

        JavaScript Info:

      • resizerShouldNotify

        boolean resizerShouldNotify(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject element)

        This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
        should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
        should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {HTMLElement} - element
        Returns:
        {boolean}
